content: This is a legitimate question that I have about this. I disagree (strongly) politically with most of the sports writers I follow on twitter and social media. After 8 years of not paying attention to a single thing Barack Obama did besides doing interviews they found amusing, they’ve now made it their mission to become political activists. What am I supposed to do? Legitimately, what am I supposed to do? It actively annoys me to read their political takes, but I value and trust their analysis of football, baseball, basketball, whatever. Should I really unfollow them to avoid being annoyed by their overly simplistic and in my view, flat out wrong political ideology? Or do I just grit my teeth and suffer through it just to get sports coverage? I’ve never once said “stick to sports”, but I just wonder how they’d feel if the roles were reversed and they had to listen to my political ideology to get to the stuff they actually care about. The old jokes about relatives posting political stuff on Facebook aren’t even relevant anymore, sportswriters are the new relatives. But it’s a one-way conversation. These writers have hundreds of thousands of followers, they’re not going to engage on twitter with people who have counterarguments to their points. I’m not even saying that they should, I just think that’s part of the frustration for people like me, I don’t want to argue politics on social media, I don’t want to see political arguments on twitter, but it’s more frustrating to just see one political ideology presented as fact without any of the other side. I guess the upside to this is that I guess writers are actually paying attention now? I guess? Or maybe the upside is that I’m following national policy geniuses marauding as sportswriters? I had no idea.
